summary: This is an internal email from August 1, 2019, discussing the need to establish a 'taint team' to review digital devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's residence. It requests support for a surge of two personnel to New York for a 30-day assignment to work with SDNY AUSAs, as the devices may contain privileged material. The email also provides a cost estimate for the deployment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of investigation, owner of seized devices
persons.context: The digital devices were seized from his residence, and the email discusses the forensic review of these items, noting they may contain privileged material.

events.title: Planning for Digital Forensic Taint Team Review
events.description: An internal email is sent to coordinate the establishment of a taint team to review digital devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's residence, as the devices may contain privileged items. The review is to be conducted in cooperation with SDNY AUSAs.

keyFacts: Numerous digital devices were seized from Jeffrey Epstein's residence.
The defense counsel claimed the seized devices contained privileged items, necessitating a 'taint team' for the initial review.
The review was to be conducted in cooperation with SDNY Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs).
A surge of two people was requested for a 30-day assignment in New York to support the review.
The Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART) had nearly completed imaging the devices, except for two encrypted hard drives.
